Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a means to censor free speech and control information flow.
Historical examples are used to illustrate how government and authoritative bodies have been wrong in the past.
The bill is perceived as coercing digital platforms to criminalize citizens for expressing opinions.
The submission calls for transparency in AI algorithms used by digital platforms instead of government curation of information.
Notable Quotes: Beware the unintended consequences of enacting a Bill which segregates our society into those who have the correct, government-approved thoughts and those who do not.
This is the coercion of commercial agencies and the outsourcing of records collection in order to criminalise Australian citizens for expressing their opinions.
I do not permit the Australian government to curate my information for me. Long live critical thinking.
